snippet: Governors across the United States are contemplating the use of state funds to keep closed parks and programs operating until the deadlock in Washington is broken.
abstract: Governors across the nation are contemplating whether to step in with state money to keep shuttered parks and programs operating until the deadlock over the federal budget is resolved.

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Los Angeles, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo.; Jack Healy from Denver; Katharine Q. Seelye from Boston; and Motoko Rich and Jennifer Preston from New York.

lead_paragraph: Governors across the United States are contemplating the use of state funds to keep closed parks and programs operating until the deadlock in Washington is broken.

headline.main: Shutdown’s Pinch Leaves Governors With Tough Calls
headline.print_headline: Shutdown’s Pinch Leaves Governors With Tough Calls
